discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The Java Serialization API is designed to recognize only a private readObject method for deserialization purposes. Since it is public ,loses its special status in the serialization process.The transient fields are not restored to their intended values threfore price remains 0.0 leading to Cookie 0.0 2.99
Answer is B because for readObject() method to be called it has to be difined as private which is not the case here

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
B correct, verified in online compiler!

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The object is created with the "Software" and "Game" strings printed due to constructor invocations.
The result of System.out.println(s) prints the title and the number of players, i.e., "Chess 2".

D is the correct answer.

Software is printed from constructor of Software class & Game is printed from the constructor of Game class. new Game("chess",2) these values passed to Game constructor are serialized, then when de-serialized and printed, it prints raw string.

Selected Answer: D
D tested correct
the right option is D. Software Game Chess 2

questions.question_text:
Given:
Captions.properties file:
user = UserName
Captions_en.properties file:
user = User name (EN)
Captions_US.properties file:
message = User name (US)
Captions_en_US.properties file:
message = User name (EN - US)
and the code fragment:
//IMG//

What is the result?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Captions_en_US.properties will be matched when currentLocale was "en_US" since it is just "en" it matches Captions_en.properties ---> User name (EN)
